Managed Disks

A new and recommended disk storage product for Azure Virtual Machines that facilitates persistent data storage.

Apply for 1RMB Trial Buy Now

Azure Managed Disks is a new and recommended disk storage product for Azure Virtual Machines that facilitates persistent data storage. Multiple Managed Disks can be used with each virtual machine. We offer two types of Managed Disks - Premium and Standard.

If you’re interested in the pricing details of Non-Managed Disk, please refer to the Non-Managed Disk and Page Blob pricing details page.

Pricing Details

  • General Purpose v1

Premium Hosting Disk

Premium Managed Disk, based on high-performance solid state drive (SSD), aims to support I/O intensive workloads, with extremely high throughput and low delay. With the help of Premium Managed Disk, we can set a permanent disk and configure its size and performance characteristics.

The total cost of Premium Managed Disks depends on the size and number of the disks, and will be affected by the number of outbound data transfers. These disk sizes provide different input/output operations per second (IOPS), throughput caps, and monthly price per GB. You can choose the option that best meets your required storage size, IOPS, and throughput. Attach several persistent disks to a VM and you can configure up to PB of storage per VM, and achieve 80,000 input/output operations per second and 1,600 MB per second disk throughput per VM at less than one millisecond latency for read operations. Premium Managed Disks are supported by DS-series, DSv2-series, and FS-series VM sizes which are specifically targeted for Premium Disks.

Standard SSD Managed Disks

Standard SSD Managed Disks, a low-cost SSD offering, are optimized for test and entry-level production workloads requiring consistent latency. Standard SSD Managed Disks can also be used for big data workloads that require high throughput. Standard SSD Managed Disks deliver lower latency compared to Standard HDDs, while improving reliability and scalability for your applications, and are available with all Azure VM sizes. Standard SSD Managed Disks can be easily upgraded to Premium SSD Managed Disks for more demanding and latency-sensitive enterprise workloads. Offered as a managed disk solution, Standard SSD Managed Disks come with the same industry leading durability and availability that you expect from Premium SSD Managed Disks.

The total cost of Standard SSD Managed Disk storage depends on the disk’s size and quantity, transaction amount and outgoing Data Transfer.

Standard Managed Disk

Standard Managed Disks employ a hard disk drive (HDD)-based storage medium. They are most suitable for development/testing not sensitive to performance changes and other non-frequent access workloads.

The total cost of Standard Managed Disk storage depends on the disk’s size and quantity, transaction amount and outgoing Data Transfer. There is no difference between different Standard Disk sizes in IOPS and throughput.

Create multiple synchronous copies of data in a Data Center.

To learn more about the redundancy options and how to use these options to obtain high availability, please view the Azure Storage Space Replication Page.

FAQ

Expand All
  • If I add an S10 or P10 disk to the virtual machine, will I be charged the cost of the total amount shown above or just the cost of the storage space I used?

    The allocated disks are charged at the same rate, irrespective of the disk space used.

  • The pricing shown is the monthly price. How do you charge if the Managed Disk is used less than one month?

    The charge uses the monthly pricing according to the hours and proportional cost.

Support & SLA

If you have any questions or need help, please visit Azure Support and select self-help service or any other method to contact us for support.

We guarantee that we can successfully process data reading requests from an Read-access Redundant Storage (RA-GRS) account at least 99.99% of the time (99.9% for the Cool Access Tier), provided that we will retry in the secondary zone from the data writing failure from the primary zone.

We guarantee that we can successfully process data reading from Locally redundant storage (LRS) and Geo Redundant Storage (GRS) accounts at least 99.9% of the time (99% for the Cool Access Tier)

We guarantee that we can successfully process data writing requests into Locally redundant storage (LRS) and geo-redundant storage (GRS) accounts and read and access Read-access Redundant Storage (RA-GRS) accounts at least 99.9% of the time (99% for the Cool Access Tier).

To learn more about the details of our Service Level Agreement, please visit the Service Level Agreements page.

The Managed Disk itself doesn’t provide a Service Level Agreement with financial support. The availability of a Managed Disk depends on the Service Level Agreement governing the basic storage used and the Virtual Machine it’s attached to. To learn more about the details of the Service Level Agreement of the Managed Disk, please visit the Managed Disk Service Level Agreements page.
